column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps
column36: Point/bumper runner-up; capable of winning races but this could be a tough task
column37: Point runner-up (3m, soft) who changed hands for £50,000 prior to finishing second on last month's bumper debut at Stratford (2m, good); capable of winning races but this could be a tough task on hurdle debut.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps
column36: Dam bumper/smart 2m-2m6f hurdle winner; makes debut with trainer in fine form
column37: Third foal; dam bumper/smart 2m-2m6f hurdle winner, out of unraced sister to Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Denman; makes debut with trainer in fine form and he could have a part to play.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps
column36: Went close on debut in a point in April 2024; absent since but respected nevertheless
column37: Beaten a head on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) in April 2024 and changed hands for 95,000euros the following month; absent since but he's a half-brother to the yard's Potters Charm, who won a Grade 1 novice hurdle here last December, and his stable won this in 2019 and 2023.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps
column36: Third in a point; soundly beaten in a bumper but should be capable of considerably better
column37: Promising third on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, soft to heavy) in April 2024; beaten 15l when fourth of eight at Exeter in February in his sole bumper (2m, good to soft) but he should be capable of considerably better for his top yard; not discounted.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps
column36: Third in both bumpers and the step up in trip is a likely plus on hurdle debut
column37: Showed promise when third last season in his two bumpers (2m, soft); others may have greater potential but the step up in trip is a likely plus on his hurdle debut and he's not ruled out.

column4: William Hill Racing Winnings Boost EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/4 Mossy Fen Coolio, 4/1 On Deadly Ground, 13/2 Spreadsheet Guru, 7/1 Only Way Is Up, 8/1 Ballyeaston,  Lightfingered Jack,  Pertemps
column36: Bumper runner-up who is bred to be suited by the step up in trip on hurdle/stable debut
column37: Pulled up in a point on debut in March but then finished second to a Willie Mullins newcomer in a bumper at Ayr (2m, good to soft) in April; has since left Andrew Slattery; makes hurdle debut with new trainer in fine form and he's bred to be suited by the step up in trip; possible player.

column4: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/2 Chasing Fire, 4/1 The Lord Maid,  Kyntara, 5/1 Katate Dori, 11/2 Impose Toi, 7/1 Idem, 10/1 Crebilly
column36: Made the frame at the three big spring festivals; respected now up in trip on reappearance
column37: Won on reappearance at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) last November then made the frame at three big festivals in the spring, including here and when second of 16 at Punchestown (2m4f, yielding) last time; his half-brother Floeur has bundles of stamina and he's respected now up in trip.

column4: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

column36: Three chase wins early this year; major player if transferring improvement back to hurdles
column37: Relished the switch to fences early this year, winning three of his first four chase starts; needs to transfer his chasing improvement back to hurdles (0-7 in this sphere) but he has a 5lb lower mark in this discipline and it will be no surprise if he has a big say on his reappearance.

column4: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/2 Chasing Fire, 4/1 The Lord Maid,  Kyntara, 5/1 Katate Dori, 11/2 Impose Toi, 7/1 Idem, 10/1 Crebilly
column36: 3-6 over hurdles and this lightly raced 7yo may well have more to offer; contender
column37: Made it 3-6 over hurdles when winning mares' handicap at Ayr (3m, good to soft) in April; unexposed over staying trips and this lightly raced 7yo, who goes well fresh, may well have more to offer; contender.

column4: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/2 Chasing Fire, 4/1 The Lord Maid,  Kyntara, 5/1 Katate Dori, 11/2 Impose Toi, 7/1 Idem, 10/1 Crebilly

column36: Well handicapped but patchy campaign last season and returns with something to prove
column37: Two-time hurdle winner who is well handicapped on his 2023-24 chase form; however, he had a patchy campaign last season and was tailed off on his sole hurdle start last term; returns with something to prove.

column4: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
column20: 7/2 Chasing Fire, 4/1 The Lord Maid,  Kyntara, 5/1 Katate Dori, 11/2 Impose Toi, 7/1 Idem, 10/1 Crebilly
column36: Second of five to well-treated winner on reappearance and has race fitness on his side
column37: Won at Kelso (2m6f, good to soft) last December and reappeared with 3l second of five behind well-treated winner at Hexham (2m7f, good) four weeks ago; has race-fitness on his side and could have a part to play.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: Disappointing in light hurdling campaign last term but not written off for in-form yard
column37: Disappointing in light hurdling campaign last season; however, this point winner won the EBF final in March 2024 and returns from some time off with his trainer in fine form; not written off on chase debut.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Andy Amo, 3/1 Hidden History, 9/2 Champagne Twist, 11/2 King Of Answers, 15/2 El Granjero, 8/1 Theatre Man, 12/1 Strackan
column36: Second in hot handicap chase in January 2024 but unable to reproduce that form last season
column37: Runner-up in hot handicap chase at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) in January 2024 and now 5lb lower; however, this 9yo was unable to reproduce that form on his three starts last season and needs to turn things around.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Andy Amo, 3/1 Hidden History, 9/2 Champagne Twist, 11/2 King Of Answers, 15/2 El Granjero, 8/1 Theatre Man, 12/1 Strackan
column36: Improvement needed on second chase start but that's possible now back up in trip
column37: Close second on handicap hurdle debut at Perth (3m2f, good to soft) in April; beaten 5l when last of five on chase debut at Hexham (2m4f, good) four weeks ago but that run gives this 6yo something to build on and this point runner-up retains potential now back up in trip; not discounted.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Andy Amo, 3/1 Hidden History, 9/2 Champagne Twist, 11/2 King Of Answers, 15/2 El Granjero, 8/1 Theatre Man, 12/1 Strackan
column36: Bumped into thriving mare when going close in March on sole previous chase start
column37: Two-time hurdle winner; 0-6 last season but one of his best runs came when going close at Stratford (2m6f, good to soft) in March on his sole chase start, when clear with a mare who was firmly on the up; this point winner is an interesting contender now back over fences on his reappearance.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Andy Amo, 3/1 Hidden History, 9/2 Champagne Twist, 11/2 King Of Answers, 15/2 El Granjero, 8/1 Theatre Man, 12/1 Strackan
column36: Did well over hurdles for new yard in the spring; open to further improvement now chasing
column37: Won big-field handicap hurdle on stable debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) in March and went close at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in April in a race that has worked out well; this lightly raced 3m point winner is open to further improvement now switched to fences by his top trainer.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Andy Amo, 3/1 Hidden History, 9/2 Champagne Twist, 11/2 King Of Answers, 15/2 El Granjero, 8/1 Theatre Man, 12/1 Strackan
column27: Mrs S M Newell & T F Lacey
column36: Hurdle hat-trick last season; pulled up when last seen but a break may have helped
column37: Prominent-racer who won three handicap hurdles in a row last term (2m4f-3m, soft); pulled up at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good to soft) in March but a break may have helped and this lightly raced 6yo is not ruled out on chase debut.

column4: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 11/4 Andy Amo, 3/1 Hidden History, 9/2 Champagne Twist, 11/2 King Of Answers, 15/2 El Granjero, 8/1 Theatre Man, 12/1 Strackan
column36: Progressive over hurdles last season and trainer won this last year with Haiti Couleurs
column37: Won in good style on handicap hurdle debut at Bangor (2m7f, good) in March before close second of 18 at Fairyhouse (2m7f, yielding to soft) in April; trainer is looking forward to sending him over fences and she won this last year with Haiti Couleurs, who went on to big things; player.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: Unexposed 7yo who retains potential now back down in trip for his reappearance
column37: Failed to stay 2m4f at Cheltenham in January and unseated early next time; won at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) last November on chase debut before close second of four at Ascot (2m1f, good to soft), and this unexposed 7yo retains potential now back down in trip for his reappearance.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column36: Lightly raced 6yo who did well over fences last season and could still have more to offer
column37: Front-runner who won late last year on first two chase starts (2m, good to soft) and was short-headed at Chepstow (2m, soft) in February; made bad mistake when soundly beaten at Newbury (2m, good) in March when last seen; this 6yo remains lightly raced and could still have more to offer.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column27: Mme Clarence Signol & Mr Xavier Brelaud
column36: On a handy mark and could build on his recent reappearance outing at Kelso
column37: Completed a hat-trick (2m, soft/heavy) two winters ago; 0-5 last season but posted a good second at Kelso (2m1f, good to soft) in March and is now 2lb lower; could build on his recent reappearance outing at Kelso.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column36: Won at Ffos Las (2m3f, heavy) in February on second chase start; not ruled out
column37: Bumper (soft) and novice hurdle (soft) winner who scored at Ffos Las (2m3f, heavy) in February on his second chase start; didn't see out 3m at Exeter (heavy) later that month; the drop back to 2m and the forecast good to soft ground are question marks, but he's in good hands and is not ruled out.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column36: Improved to win on chase debut at Worcester and could take a 6lb rise in his stride
column37: Heavy-ground maiden hurdle winner who improved for the switch to fences to win at Worcester (2m, good) last month; open to further improvement in this sphere and could take a 6lb rise in his stride.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column36: Grade 2 juvenile hurdle winner in February; could have a very bright future over fences
column37: Ex-French 4yo who won the Grade 2 Adonis Juvenile Hurdle at Kempton (2m, good to soft) in February on second British start; well beaten in Grade 1 here in April but he's a big horse who could have a very bright future over fences and receives a handy 4yo allowance on his chase/handicap debut.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column27: E A R L Elevage De Busset
column36: Consistent over hurdles and his half-brother improved when sent over fences
column37: Consistent over hurdles, winning at Hereford (2m3f, soft) in January then fifth of 11 in good race at Ascot (2m3f, good); only six and his half-brother Inflexible improved when sent over fences; reappears with trainer among the winners and he's not discounted.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column36: Continues to tumble down the weights but hard to fancy on this year's evidence
column37: Three-time winner for Willie Mullins who continues to tumble down the weights; however, he's hard to fancy on this year's evidence; wears first-time cheekpieces and a reapplied tongue-tie.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column36: Hit with 12lb rise for Worcester win and this is hotter, but he did it very easily
column37: Won two in a row last winter (1m7f/2m, good to soft) and returned from a break for easy win at Worcester (2m, good) last month; hit with 12lb rise for last time and he's in a hotter race today, but his trainer won this in 2017 and 2021 and he has to be respected given his Worcester dominance.

column4: Introducing William Hill Half A Mill Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 4/1 Mambonumberfive, 5/1 Highlands Legacy, 11/2 Javert Allen,  Dunstall Rambler, 13/2 Ryan's Rocket,  Alcedo, 8/1 Netywell, 9/1 Jour d'Evasion, 16/1 Flamelco, 100/1 Glengouly
column27: A Blin, Mme A Blin, Et Al
column36: Three wins last season but there's a suspicion he'll be vulnerable now up in grade
column37: Three wins last season (1m7f-2m1f, good-soft), the latest at Plumpton in April, and returned from a break to finish second of three at Sedgefield (2m, good to soft) last month; could build on that latest performance but there's a suspicion he'll be vulnerable now up in grade.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest

column37: Cruised through the race when clear second in the Kim Muir at Cheltenham (3m2f, good to soft) in March, beaten just a neck, then failed to stay in the Irish National (3m5f) next time; this drop back in trip could be a good move and he's made a winning reappearance in each of the last two seasons.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

column36: Best efforts have come over staying trips but he reappears with trainer in excellent form
column37: 10yo whose best form has come over staying trips and he was third in the 4m Scottish National in April when last seen; however, he may be able to cope with this drop back in trip (he won over 2m4f in January 2022 when he last went below 3m) and he reappears with his trainer in excellent form.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Pulled up in March last time but retains potential and stable does well over these fences
column37: Pulled up at Doncaster (3m2f, good) in March when last seen but he made a very promising start to his chasing career late last year, with wins at Ayr (2m4f, good) and Haydock (2m5f, soft); of interest on that form and his stable does well over these fences; respected on reappearance.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Has dropped down the weights but soundly beaten on last two chase starts in the spring
column37: He showed spark last winter and has dropped down the weights, but this 12yo was soundly beaten in handicaps at the Cheltenham and Punchestown festivals in the spring, and returned from a break with a heavy defeat in the Cesarewitch on the Flat last month; needs to turn things around.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Pulled up on final two runs last term but he had wind op since and won this 12 months ago
column37: Pulled up on final two starts last season; however, he's had a wind operation since and his two previous wind surgeries have yielded wins on his first race back; won this 12 months ago (good to soft) and this prominent-racer could make another bold bid on his return to action.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column32: C Nightingale & Hold My Beer Partnership
column36: Did well after joining this yard but well beaten last month and needs to bounce back
column37: Won in March on first two starts for this yard (2m6f, good to soft/good); encouraging second on reappearance at Market Rasen (2m5f, good) in September but well beaten in a match at Wetherby (2m3f, good) last month and this is a very tough race in which to try to bounce back.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: 6yo who was in contention when making mistake two out in the Topham over C&D in April
column37: 0-6 last season, mixing hurdles and fences; however, he ran well more often than not and was in contention when making a mistake two out in the Topham over C&D (good to soft) in April in first-time cheekpieces (retained); only six and runs off 2lb lower this afternoon; could be involved.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Took to these fences well when runner-up in the Foxhunters' over C&D in April
column37: Took to these fences well when runner-up in the Foxhunters' over C&D (good to soft) in April; shaped as though he may have needed the run at Worcester in September following a break and he could give a good account.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Third and seventh in last two runnings of this; capable of being in the mix if on song
column37: He's reappeared in this race in each of the last two seasons, finishing third in 2023 and seventh last year; this 10yo was pulled up on his final two starts last term but is capable of being in the mix if back on song.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Below par in February when last seen but enjoyed fine season otherwise and goes well fresh
column37: 10yo who was below par in February when last seen but enjoyed a fine campaign otherwise, posting two wins (2m5f/2m3f, soft/good to soft) before two second placings behind well handicapped winners (2m5f, good/good to soft); goes well fresh and could have a part to play on reappearance.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Won in September but pulled up since; has to bounce back with a career-best effort
column37: Ex-Dan Skelton 8yo who won at Worcester (2m4f, good to soft) in September on third start for this yard; fast ground may not have suited at Chepstow since (pulled up) but he has to bounce back with a career-best effort.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Won at Carlisle in April; in a hot race on this stable debut & has to be better than ever
column37: Heavy-ground maiden hurdle winner who got off the mark at the 12th attempt over fences, when wearing first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Carlisle (2m4f, good) in April on final run for Stuart Crawford; sold for £55,000 in July; in a hot race on this stable debut and has to be better than ever.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column32: Fine Claret Racing & T S Ingham
column36: Second in this last year when 3lb higher but below par on his last few starts
column37: Runner-up to King Turgeon in this race last year (good to soft) and he's 3lb lower today; went close at Market Rasen (2m5f, good) in June and the return to these unique fences could re-ignite some spark, but he's been below par on his last three runs and certainly needs to raise his game.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: Failed to kick on last season after finishing third in this but he's not ruled out
column37: Returned from break to finish third in this last year (good to soft); failed to kick on subsequently and pulled up in February when last seen, but he goes well fresh and is 3lb lower than 12 months ago; blinkers (no obvious positive impact when worn previously) replace cheekpieces; not ruled out.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column27: Mrs P Souverain & Mr A De Boisbrunet
column32: L Cross, S Cross & J Fitzpatrick
column36: Pulled up when last seen but on a handy mark and this C&D should suit his prominent style
column37: Pulled up in April on final outing of that three-race campaign; however, he has a good reappearance record and showed promise first time up last season; runs off last winning mark and this C&D should suit his prominent style; he's not a forlorn hope.

column4: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
column20: 9/2 King Turgeon, 5/1 White Rhino, 11/2 Johnnywho, 8/1 Our Power, 9/1 Gaboriot, 10/1 Excello, 12/1 Frero Banbou,  Jet Plane, 14/1 Colonel Harry,  Vintage Fizz, 20/1 Mahons Glory,  If Not For Dylan, 25/1 Nocte Volatus,  Bleu d'Enfer,  Seddon,  Happy And Fine, 50/1 Mount Tempest
column36: 10yo who is out of the handicap but could be the type to take well to these fences
column37: From out of the handicap this 10yo competes off a career-low mark; however, he made all at Newcastle (2m7f, soft) in January and could be just the type of front-runner to take well to these fences; fairly encouraging reappearance over the regular fences here a fortnight ago (3m1f, good; bad mistake three out) and could produce a bold show in a first-time tongue-tie.

column37: 9yo who was trained in Ireland until shaping quite well when third of four at Southwell (2m, good) five weeks ago; now 3lb lower and William Maggs's 5lb claim is an added bonus; one of two plausible contenders for Donald McCain.

column37: Reliable in nine runs over hurdles and posted a personal best when easily winning at Chepstow (2m, heavy) in February 2024; a 5lb higher mark hardly looks insurmountable but a long absence since is a more of a concern.

column37: Lightly raced type who easily landed the odds in maiden at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) last December; proved disappointing there on heavy ground the following month, jumping sketchily, but now moves into handicaps with plenty of untapped potential; very interesting candidate.

column37: Improved a chunk to win well at Lingfield (2m, soft) last winter, and he was going smoothly when brought down three out at Sandown next time; retains potential and represents last season's successful trainer-jockey combination; high on the list.

column37: Goes well with positive tactics, making all in novices at Carlisle and Kelso last season and far from disgraced in competitive 2m handicaps at Sandown; still relatively lightly raced and not discounted on return.

column37: Won a soft-ground hurdle in France in the summer of 2024 and made the frame in three chases afterwards, but he was weak in the market and showed little on British debut in handicap hurdle at Chepstow last month; needs a refitted hood to prompt a swift revival.

column36: Wonderfully durable over the years but suited by the Curragh; work to do under penalty
column37: Wonderfully durable but the majority of his big wins have come at the Curragh, where he's won five Group races at 6f and 5f, including in September (made most; soft); he's raced only once on this track, when beaten over 4l in the 2022 running, and likely has some work to do under a penalty.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Wentworth Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 7/4 Montassib, 9/2 Spycatcher, 11/2 Art Power, 6/1 Apollo One, 9/1 Zoum Zoum, 20/1 Balmoral Lady,  Circe,  Vadream, 25/1 Miss Nightfall, 28/1 Navassa Island,  Stop The Cavalry, 33/1 Magic Basma, 50/1 Nariko
column36: Won C&D Listed in March; emphatic success in Group 3 latest; solid chance despite penalty
column37: A shade fortunate to win a C&D Listed race (good to soft) in March but there are some smart sprinting performances in his record and he was an emphatic winner of a Group 3 at Chantilly (6f, very soft) 12 days ago; has less than 1l to make up on Art Power on their Curragh form previously and the switch in track may well play more in this one's favour.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Wentworth Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 7/4 Montassib, 9/2 Spycatcher, 11/2 Art Power, 6/1 Apollo One, 9/1 Zoum Zoum, 20/1 Balmoral Lady,  Circe,  Vadream, 25/1 Miss Nightfall, 28/1 Navassa Island,  Stop The Cavalry, 33/1 Magic Basma, 50/1 Nariko
column36: Superb at different levels, including Gr3 win last October; luckless in that race latest
column37: A splendid sprinter who, after many valiant efforts in defeat, gained a richly deserved Group 3 win at Ascot (soft) last October; was back in his familiar luckless role when just losing out in the same race last month but he has another sterling run in him on a track where he's gone close in the Portland on two occasions.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Wentworth Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 7/4 Montassib, 9/2 Spycatcher, 11/2 Art Power, 6/1 Apollo One, 9/1 Zoum Zoum, 20/1 Balmoral Lady,  Circe,  Vadream, 25/1 Miss Nightfall, 28/1 Navassa Island,  Stop The Cavalry, 33/1 Magic Basma, 50/1 Nariko
column36: Group 1 winner in 2024; hard to withstand his late dash when on song; major player
column37: C&D Listed winner; has a colourful run style as he arrives late on the scene but his finishing dash is hard to withstand when on song, as for a Group 1 win at Haydock (good; well suited by soft) in 2024; a promising belated return over 5f in September was followed by a downbeat effort in a Group 1 at Ascot but he's never really flourished on that track and he has much more going for him down in class on soft ground.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Wentworth Stakes (Listed Race)

column37: Advanced her form again when landing 7f Haydock handicap (good) in August; good fourth of ten at Southwell (1m, AW) the following month but she has something to find in this company, with stamina not assured either.

column36: Second to Estrange in this last year; running well at Group level lately; leading claims
column37: Found only Estrange too strong in this race on soft last year; three solid efforts in defeat at Group level this year and the one to beat with her sights lowered.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

column36: Smart handicap performance last time and third in a Listed race in May; won on soft/heavy
column37: Smart handicap performance when back to form with a bang to win over 1m2f Nottingham 24 days ago, an effort which was boosted by the success of the second in a warm race at Kempton on Monday; only seventh in this race 12 months ago but she did place in a Goodwood Listed event this spring; successful on soft/heavy; capable of playing a prominent role.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

column36: Placed in handicaps when last seen in midsummer but made no impact in this race last year
column37: Placed in handicaps at Hamilton when last seen in midsummer but drawn a blank since 2yo debut success on heavy and she was well beaten in this race last year; others are more obvious.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

column36: Career best when fifth in French Listed race but needs another to go close here
column37: Posted a career-best RPR when fifth of 11 in 1m2f Saint-Cloud Listed race on soft five weeks ago but will require another improved performance to get heavily involved here.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: Won novices on first two starts but down the field in Bath Listed event since
column37: Began career with wins in four-runner novice races at Hamilton (1m3f, good to firm) in August and Ripon (1m4f, good) in September; lost her unbeaten record but actually advanced her RPR when down the field in 1m6f Listed event at Bath (good to soft) last month; further progress possible after only three runs but a good chunk of improvement will be needed.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: Runner-up twice in Listed races on soft this year & looks sure to make presence felt again
column37: Has won a Newbury novice and finished runner-up in a pair of 1m2f Listed events in her three races on soft ground; had a subsequent French Listed winner behind in third on the latest occasion and she looks sure to make her presence felt again.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

column36: Four wins this year; freshened up since lesser run at St Leger meeting; could bounce back
column37: Typical improver from her yard, with four wins this season, including on soft; freshened up since finishing only sixth in 1m4f fillies' handicap at the St Leger meeting here in September; no surprise were she to resume her progression.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: In good form in handicaps this autumn but faces a stiff task here
column37: First run on ground softer than good when scoring comfortably in six-runner handicap at Ayr (1m2f, good to soft) in September; stamina seemed stretched when fourth in 1m6f handicap at Nottingham (good to soft again) since and treated as if still in form; stiff task here, though.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

column32: Mr & Mrs Dowling And & Mrs Marney
column36: Steady progress, winning 1m AW novice latest, but this is a jump in class
column37: Runner-up on first two starts for James Fanshawe before landing the odds in 1m Southwell novice in September; likely to stay 1m2f but this is a jump in class and her ability to handle ground conditions has to be taken on trust.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: Three of five runs in Group 1s; fair fourth dropped to Listed latest; should stay 1m2f
column37: Ran well in the 1,000 Guineas on only her second start, then looked a non-stayer in the Oaks; well held in another Group 1 in July but back on track with her sights lowered when fourth in 1m Newmarket Listed race six weeks ago; shaped on that occasion as if 1m2f might be within range but this ground is an unknown.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: Made all in 1m2f h'cap in August; possibly failed to stay 1m4f latest; retains potential
column37: Impressive all-the-way winner of 1m2f Haydock handicap (good) on only her third start; possibly stretched by 1m4f when fourth of six to Perfect Your Craft in Newmarket handicap since; while Danielle has to be considered connections' first string, this low-mileage 3yo retains potential.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: Course win on soft; back on up with 1m2f h'cap win this autumn; fifth in Listed race since
column37: Soft-ground course maiden winner last October; back on the up with 1m2f Newbury handicap success on good to soft in September and creditable fifth in 1m2f French Listed race (very soft) since; tongue-tied first time.

column4: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Irish EBF Gillies Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
column20: 9/4 Danielle, 9/2 Anna Swan, 11/2 Elwateen, 9/1 Loughville, 11/1 Perfect Your Craft, 12/1 Hot Flame, 14/1 Karmology, 16/1 Akecheta,  Janey Mackers, 20/1 Warda Jamila,  Bosphorus Rose, 25/1 Ciara Pearl,  Aequitas, 33/1 Lunar Eclipse,  Crystal Flyer, 40/1 Celestias Comet, 50/1 Brielle, 66/1 Crown's Lady
column36: Largely progressive, including C&D win on good soft; likely has more to offer
column37: C&D handicap debut success on good to soft in July; only fifth in 1m4f St Leger meeting handicap here next time but resumed her progression when seeing off five rivals (including Hot Flame) in 1m4f Newmarket handicap (good) last month; heavy-ground novice winner last autumn; likely has more to offer.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

column36: 1m4f has not worked so far but he rallied strongly over 1m2f on heavy going here latest
column37: Front-runner or usually races very prominently; the last of his four wins last year came at this track and he's also scored at Chester and York this season; good third here two weeks ago; all those races were over about 1m2f and his three attempts at 1m4f failed to prove his stamina, but he rallied strongly on that latest start and that was on heavy going.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Career-best form lately but he's not the easiest to win with given his waiting tactics
column37: Acts on heavy; has a very solid record at Doncaster, albeit without winning (seventh in this race last year but not beaten far); scored over 1m4f at Haydock in May and career-best form over 1m6f/1m5f on last three outings, but he's not the easiest to win with given his waiting tactics.
column68: 13:03 | Gowran Park | The King Of Prs

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

column36: Won this on soft last year and stormed clear at Epsom on his only start this season
column37: Successful 2024 culminated in a clearcut triumph in this race (soft; has won on heavy); not seen again until Epsom (1m2f, good to soft) six weeks ago but that was another career best, storming just over 4l clear under Jack Dace; another 9lb higher today (13lb higher than 12 months ago) but, going from strength to strength, he may well complete a November Handicap double.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column27: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
column36: Best known as a mud-loving stayer but it's hard to recommend him at present
column37: Best known as a mud-loving stayer but his last win (2m2f) was in September 2023, he sparked only once last season and it's hard to recommend him on anything he's done in 2025; last raced over a trip this short in June 2021.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: To win this requires another new high but he has won two of his three races on heavy going
column37: Respectable eighth in this race last year; fourth over 14.5f here in October was career-best form, followed by best AW form 18 days ago; to win this requires another new high but he has won two of his three races on heavy going.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Tailed off in this 2024; creeping up weights but needs respect, if he goes on the ground
column37: His novice win was on soft going but he was tailed off when 12-1 in this race last year; won at Ayr (1m5f) this June and has been bang there over 1m4f/1m2f on his last three starts, all on good or firmer; creeping up the weights but needs respect, if he goes on the ground.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column32: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
column36: Well beaten on yard/seasonal debut in a four-runner conditions event (2m2f) 19 days ago
column37: Won a 1m2f maiden (heavy) and 1m6f Listed race last year for Aidan O'Brien; well beaten on final race for him (2m) and also when reappearing in a four-runner conditions event at Pontefract (2m2f) 19 days ago; usual blinkers are restored but others have more pressing claims.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Won on heavy; raised another 5lb but this lightly raced 3yo could easily have more to give
column37: 2-2 as 2yo, latterly on heavy going, and progressive this term in his three handicaps; second here (1m2f, good to soft) on penultimate start and he put his head down in a sustained duel when short-headed by another unexposed sort at Leicester (1m4f, good to soft; third has won since) on latest; raised another 5lb but this lightly raced 3yo could easily have more to give.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Potential with the greater stamina test but tough race for handicap debut off a lofty mark
column37: Four races, easily best form when he came from last to be close third of seven in Listed event at Hamilton (1m3f, good; 150-1) in July; turned over at 1-5 in a novice there (1m3f, good to firm) in August when they went no pace; now tongue tied; retains potential, particularly given the greater stamina test, but this tough race for handicap debut off a lofty mark asks a big question; dam is half-sister to 2015 Ebor and November Handicap winner Litigant.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Acts on heavy but best known at up to about 1m2f, so there is plenty for him to prove
column37: Acts on heavy; best known at up to about 1m2f and had his first race over this far when a close third of seven at Goodwood (good to firm) in August, albeit in a slowly run race; well beaten since over 1m5f and 1m2f (heavy; under Rose Dawes) so there is plenty for him to prove

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Mud-lover; won this race in 2022 and the Chester Cup in 2023; big questions these days
column37: Easily best known for his exploits on soft/heavy ground, which on the Flat brought him big-race wins in this race in 2022 and the Chester Cup in 2023; latter was off 2lb higher than today but he did not fire on all cylinders last March-July and was tailed off in an AW race in March on his only run since.

column4: Virgin Bet November Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 6/1 Castle Cove,  Hopewell Rock, 13/2 Lord Melbourne, 8/1 Master Vintner, 9/1 Atherstone Warrior, 12/1 Stressfree, 14/1 Grey Cuban,  Miller Spirit,  Master Builder, 16/1 Maxi King,  Insanity, 18/1 Hot Fuss, 22/1 Oneforthegutter, 25/1 Castle Stuart,  Adjuvant,  Metier, 33/1 Miss Dolly Rocker,  Tiernan, 40/1 Tashkhan, 50/1 Majestic,  Great Bedwyn, 66/1 Chemistry, 100/1 Platoon
column36: Ex-Aidan O'Brien; down the field in his three races for new yard; this is a new trip

column20: 13/8 Jubilee Alpha, 5/1 Porter In The Park, 11/2 Bethpage, 7/1 Laravie, 8/1 Jena d'Oudairies,  Sweet Caryline, 10/1 Love Of Neymore
column36: In career-best form in the spring; resumes on career-high mark but still considered
column37: In career-best form in the spring, most recently when winning readily at Stratford (3m2f, good); resumes on another career-high mark but is effective on this track (albeit ran poorly in this race a year ago) and will be fine over today's shorter trip; seems best suited by good ground.

column4: BetMGM Paul & Richard Barber Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 13/8 Jubilee Alpha, 5/1 Porter In The Park, 11/2 Bethpage, 7/1 Laravie, 8/1 Jena d'Oudairies,  Sweet Caryline, 10/1 Love Of Neymore
column36: Won four in a row in early part of season; ran as though something was amiss last month
column37: Won four in a row (2m4f-2m7f, good) when fitted with a visor in May-July; can cope if the ground eases and may still have further improvement to come, but she dropped out as though something was amiss at Chepstow last month and this is a tough race in which to rebound.

column4: BetMGM Paul & Richard Barber Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 13/8 Jubilee Alpha, 5/1 Porter In The Park, 11/2 Bethpage, 7/1 Laravie, 8/1 Jena d'Oudairies,  Sweet Caryline, 10/1 Love Of Neymore
column36: Second in this last year and ran well last month; player if there's no significant rain
column37: Runner-up off 2lb lower in this race a year ago and seemed to have been refreshed by 81-day break when respectable third at Ludlow (2m5f, good to firm) last month; if the ground stays good here, she probably won't be far away.

column4: BetMGM Paul & Richard Barber Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 13/8 Jubilee Alpha, 5/1 Porter In The Park, 11/2 Bethpage, 7/1 Laravie, 8/1 Jena d'Oudairies,  Sweet Caryline, 10/1 Love Of Neymore
column36: Front-runner; absent since February but this course winner is not yet fully exposed
column37: Front-runner who won here (2m4f, good to soft) last December and gave another good account when third at Chepstow (2m7f, soft) in February; has fitness to prove after 272-day break but is not yet fully exposed after only seven hurdle runs; no surprise if she gives this a good shot.

column4: BetMGM Paul & Richard Barber Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 13/8 Jubilee Alpha, 5/1 Porter In The Park, 11/2 Bethpage, 7/1 Laravie, 8/1 Jena d'Oudairies,  Sweet Caryline, 10/1 Love Of Neymore

column4: BetMGM Paul & Richard Barber Memorial Mares' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
column20: 13/8 Jubilee Alpha, 5/1 Porter In The Park, 11/2 Bethpage, 7/1 Laravie, 8/1 Jena d'Oudairies,  Sweet Caryline, 10/1 Love Of Neymore
column36: Held on gamely at Chepstow last month; 4lb wrong in this stronger race, though
column37: Held on gamely to prevail by a neck at Chepstow (2m, good) last month, after a break, and is now 3-9 over hurdles; could still have untapped potential over today's longer trip and is evidently in good nick but contests this much stronger race from 4lb out of the weights.

column4: Boodles Rising Stars Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 Blueking d'Oroux, 5/2 Cobra Queen, 8/1 Breaking Cover, 12/1 Rightsotom, 25/1 Settle Down Jill
column36: Smart hurdler; came up short on chase debut but could be a different proposition here
column37: Classy hurdler and the winner of two Grade 2s (2m3f/2m5f; good ground); disappointing he couldn't make a winning chase debut when long odds-on at Newton Abbot but the winner is no slouch and this 6yo should have learned plenty (jumping lacked fluency); every chance of going one better in a race his stable has won many a time.

column4: Boodles Rising Stars Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
column20: 4/6 Blueking d'Oroux, 5/2 Cobra Queen, 8/1 Breaking Cover, 12/1 Rightsotom, 25/1 Settle Down Jill

column36: Useful hurdler when on his game; needed to run better on recent chase debut at Cheltenham
column37: Useful hurdler when on his game (not always the case); really needed to run better on chase debut in a recent Cheltenham handicap to believe he might provide the answer to this Grade 2; cheekpieces added to tongue-strap.

column4: Boodles Rising Stars Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

column37: Vastly inferior over hurdles to Blueking d'Oroux but already a better chaser (2-4) and still improving judged on her clearcut win last time at Roscommon (2m5f, good to yielding); has earned herself a crack at a race of this stature.

column37: His last win came in a hunter chase back in late May, since when he's offered little in handicaps, three over fences and last week back hurdling at Plumpton; has to rate the least likely winner of today's four runners.

column4: BetMGM Elite Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/7 Rubaud, 4/1 Hamlet's Night, 12/1 Tax For Max, 20/1 Frere d'Armes
column36: Perhaps flattered by his proximity to the winner at Cheltenham but going the right way
column37: Couldn't win on the Flat but performed to a useful level for the Kublers; wasn't overly troubled in his two wins over hurdles (Stratford/Warwick; both good ground) before keeping a good horse honest on unfavourable terms at Cheltenham; quite possibly flattered in that messy race (winner dictated matters) but he's going the right way; hooded for last three races.

column4: BetMGM Elite Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
column20: 2/7 Rubaud, 4/1 Hamlet's Night, 12/1 Tax For Max, 20/1 Frere d'Armes
column36: Smart at best for Willie Mullins but some way below par in two runs for current yard
column37: Competitive in all sorts of races in these colours for Willie Mullins and was at his best over hurdles; has yet to recapture his peak form in two runs for current yard, last time finishing a well-held third in a handicap at Newton Abbot; needs to leave that form behind if he's to be troubling Rubaud.

column4: 64th Badger Beers Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

column37: 5lb higher than when a clear second in this two years ago (after his previous wind operation) but he can deal with this mark and narrowly missed out off 1lb higher at Ascot in February (3m, good), after which he was pulled up in the Grand National and Sandown's big chase in April; shows his form at this time of year and his trainer seeks a 12th win this race; lots to like.

column37: Races prominently; runner-up over fences and hurdles in May (after a break) but will do well to bounce back from a couple of no-shows (chases over 2m5f/3m5f) in a handicap of this stature.

column4: 64th Badger Beers Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Art Of Diplomacy, 11/4 Threeunderthrufive, 9/2 Gustavian, 13/2 Scarface, 7/1 Soul Icon, 8/1 Credo, 25/1 Tommie Beau
column36: Has never won off this high a mark but there are reasons for believing she can run well
column37: Returns lacking the visor that was fitted for her final four races of last season, two of which she won (3m, good to soft; beat Gustavian; 3m, good; both veterans' handicaps); was probably ready for a break when off-colour last time; has won around here and not dismissed despite never having defied this high a mark.

column4: 64th Badger Beers Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
column20: 5/2 Art Of Diplomacy, 11/4 Threeunderthrufive, 9/2 Gustavian, 13/2 Scarface, 7/1 Soul Icon, 8/1 Credo, 25/1 Tommie Beau
column36: Stuck on a losing run and prone to mistakes, but has the form to feature off this mark
column37: Stuck on a losing run; he was ridden more patiently than is often the case when a remote third in this 12 months ago; none too consistent and can make some serious mistakes, but a case can be made on his best form and he did jump well when going too hard up front when second to Credo at Exeter two runs back (February); interesting after another wind op.

column37: Hasn't smacked of an imminent winner in going down by about 15l at Worcester and just under 10l at Plumpton.

column37: £21,000 3yo; fifth foal; dam unraced half-sister to bumper and useful 2m1f-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Some Tikket; one of two newcomers representing the Tizzard yard.

column4: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)

column37: Placed in a bumper at Down Royal and second of four on stable debut at Ludlow (good to firm); that doesn't amount to strong form but she has some bumper experience behind her, unlike most of these.

column37: Dual Tapeta winner who is very well treated on old form but last win was in February 2023 and he finished tailed off here (2m) on his reappearance last month; opposable.

column37: 4yo who got back on track when forging clear to score under Oliver Carmichael here (2m) 11 days ago; this is a deeper race but a 4lb rise looks fair enough and he's unexposed on Tapeta; big player again back in trip.

column19: The one to beat on hurdles form is BREAK MY SOUL who wasn't beaten far in a Gr. 3 around here and wasn't disgraced in Gr. 1 runs
column20: 5/2 Break My Soul, 100/30 Lantry Lady, 5/1 Whatcouldhavebeen, 6/1 The Great Nudie, 8/1 Crescent Moon,  Qualimita, 10/1 Diamond Nora
column36: Top-rated of these courtesy of two hurdling wins and some good efforts at Gr.1 level
column37: Top-rated of these over timber with a mark of 140; won her sole point start and twice a winner over hurdles; on the wrong side of tight finishes several times in handicaps for Nicky Henderson and beaten under 3l by Kitzbuhel here in February in a Grade 3 (2m, soft); not disgraced in Grade 1 runs at Aintree and Punchestown at the end of last season; the one to beat on chasing bow.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
column19: The one to beat on hurdles form is BREAK MY SOUL who wasn't beaten far in a Gr. 3 around here and wasn't disgraced in Gr. 1 runs

column27: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
column36: Second in sole point and made a decent chase debut but tailed off last time; can do better
column37: A runner-up in her only point-to-point start, she got off the mark over hurdles at the seventh attempt at Fairyhouse in April (2m4f, yielding); made a bright start to her chasing career when fourth in a decent quality beginners' chase at Galway, but didn't build on that at Down Royal when tailed off, not jumping fluently; can do better.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
column19: The one to beat on hurdles form is BREAK MY SOUL who wasn't beaten far in a Gr. 3 around here and wasn't disgraced in Gr. 1 runs

column36: Winner of sole point start and twice a winner over hurdles, but a bit to find on ratings
column37: Winner of her sole point start and twice a winner over hurdles; her rating of 118 leaves her with a bit to find in this company, though.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
column19: The one to beat on hurdles form is BREAK MY SOUL who wasn't beaten far in a Gr. 3 around here and wasn't disgraced in Gr. 1 runs
column20: 5/2 Break My Soul, 100/30 Lantry Lady, 5/1 Whatcouldhavebeen, 6/1 The Great Nudie, 8/1 Crescent Moon,  Qualimita, 10/1 Diamond Nora
column36: Lightly-raced 7yo was an easy winner of a Gr. 3 around here; yard does well with chasers
column37: Lightly-raced 7yo; rated 138 over hurdles following some good efforts, including easily winning a Grade 3 around here over 2m in February last year; no shame in her fourth-place finish in the mares' hurdle at Cheltenham following that; some lesser efforts after that, but stable does well with chasers and softer conditions are in her favour.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
column19: The one to beat on hurdles form is BREAK MY SOUL who wasn't beaten far in a Gr. 3 around here and wasn't disgraced in Gr. 1 runs
column20: 5/2 Break My Soul, 100/30 Lantry Lady, 5/1 Whatcouldhavebeen, 6/1 The Great Nudie, 8/1 Crescent Moon,  Qualimita, 10/1 Diamond Nora
column36: Expensive point purchase is winless from 8 over hurdles; may do better over fences
column37: Expensive purchase following a very easy point-to-point win but has been disappointing over hurdles with no wins from eight attempts and often beaten at short prices; she may do better over fences now, but others are more likely all the same.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
column19: The one to beat on hurdles form is BREAK MY SOUL who wasn't beaten far in a Gr. 3 around here and wasn't disgraced in Gr. 1 runs
column20: 5/2 Break My Soul, 100/30 Lantry Lady, 5/1 Whatcouldhavebeen, 6/1 The Great Nudie, 8/1 Crescent Moon,  Qualimita, 10/1 Diamond Nora
column36: Point winner is a two-time winner over hurdles and can rate higher in this sphere
column37: Comfortable winner of sole point-to-point start; twice a winner over hurdles, over 2m5f at Tramore and an extended 2m3f at Punchestown, both in softer conditions; made encouraging return to action here last month when second despite the vet finding blood in her nostril; her hurdle exploits leave her with a rating of 126 and she could very well rate higher in this sphere, but the trip could be on the short side.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
